meanings.definition: To construct or assemble (a building or structure) from prefabricated parts.
meanings.sent1: The workers were prefabbing the new house in record time.
meanings.sent2: The construction company specializes in prefabbing modular homes.
meanings.sent3: The team joked that they were prefabbing a house like putting together a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent4: She prefabbed the bookshelves with such precision, it was like magic.
meanings.sent5: The sound of hammers and drills filled the air as they prefabbed the entire office building.

meanings.definition: The process of constructing or assembling a building or structure from prefabricated parts.
meanings.sent1: Prefabbing has become a popular method in the construction industry.
meanings.sent2: The prefabbing of the school was completed ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The children were amazed by the speed of the prefabbing of their new playground.
meanings.sent4: The efficiency of prefabbing saved both time and resources for the project.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of prefabbing is how quickly a structure can come together.
